page.title: 16BROAD OAK
page.content: Broad Oak is a small hamlet,south-east of Odiham, near the A287 Farnham road. The primary land cover is deciduous woodland, with a variety of mature trees. The hamlet of Broad Oak is named after the ancient Oak tree growing on the common. It is over 500 years old and folklore and tradition surrounds the tree. Along Broad Oak Lane there are some farms, modern houses and old cottages. The secondary land cover is mainly cereal crops; barley and maize. There are three small ponds in the area. A new house has been built in an old apple orchard A market gardening business thrives on the opposite side of the lane. One farm, breeds horses and rears sheep. The lane is a no-through road, ending at Broad Oak Bridge on the Basingstoke Canal. The banks of the canal are covered with mature, deciduous trees.
